Problem:
Study the effect of a complex function \\( z \mapsto e^{iz} \\) on a real variable \\( x \\) and its integration relating to the Fourier transform of a signal \\( s(t) \), represented as \\( S(f) = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} s(t) e^{-i2\pi f t} dt. \\)

If a normalization process is applied to \\( s(t) \\) post the transformation \\( z \mapsto e^{iz} \\), does the Fourier transform \\( S(f) \\) at frequency \\( f \\) exclusively depend on the initial function \\( s(t) \\) without consideration of the transformation effect?
Explanation: The normalization process will affect the amplitude spectra but not eliminate the phase shift effects introduced by \\( z \mapsto e^{iz} \\). Therefore, the Fourier transform \\( S(f) \\) will still reflect changes induced by the transformation and not solely depend on the original \\( s(t) \\).
